title: UWMed - UW Medicine
cleaned_text: An initiative to spread U.S. medical patients' access to their physicians' clinical notes will receive a $10 million infusion, it was announced today. Its survival rate of people who undergo cardiopulmonary resuscitation, or CPR, outside of hospitals is 19.9 percent. A study published today in JAMA Pediatrics links the use of antidepressants during pregnancy to an increased risk of autism in children. Individuals with depression are more than twice as likely to have hospitalizations that might be preventable with timely outpatient medical care in the community, a new study finds.
